sub_topic: Solving systems of nonlinear equations using Newton's method
message_1:
Consider the system of nonlinear equations:
$$
\begin{cases}
x^2 + y^2 - 9 = 0 \\
\ln(x+1) + e^y - 6 =0
\end{cases}
$$
Using Newton's method, find an approximation of the solution $(x,y)$ such that $|x-x_0|<0.001$ and $|y-y_0|<0.001$, where $(x_0,y_0)=(1,1)$ is the initial guess.
